title.narrative: TRANSPerú – Sustainable Urban Transport NAMA Peru

description.narrative: The NAMA Support Project (NSP) was developed to halt the trend towards urban sprawl, dominated by cars, through high-quality public transport/vehicle fleet optimisation. This requires: policy framework, additional infrastructure & institutional set-up. A policy matrix integrates the transformation agenda: integrated mass public transit system in the metropolitan area of Lima; non-motorised transport; institutional set-up for urban transport management; mitigation of greenhous gas (GHG) emissions and pollutants from motor vehicles; modernisation of the public transport motor vehicle fleet; support to authorities on sustainable urban transport. The NSP creates the basis for structural change. Financial & technical support are closely linked: steering committee coordination; mitigation: implementation of selected aspects in the policy matrix at (sub-)national level; measurement, reporting & verification system. GHG emissions to be reduced by at least 5.6 Mt CO2e 2015-2025 compared to BAU.
